The Green Scare:
Lecture at Yale University

Date:
Sunday, June 13, 2010
Time:
3:00pm - 5:00pm
Location:
Yale University, William L. Harkness Hall,
100 Wall St., (Rm 119)

Independent journalist Will Potter of GreenIsTheNewRed.com

will discuss the emerging use of the category of “eco-terrorism” to criminalize and silence the work of animal rights activists. Potter will discuss the impacts of the Animal Enterprise Terrorism Act (AETA) on civil rights and liberties and academic freedom.

Activist & former SHAC 7 prisoner Andy Stepanian will tell his personal story of standing up to one of the world’s largest contract animal testing labs, being charged with “terrorism” for his efforts, and serving 3 years in a federal prison.

Justin Goodman, Associate Director of Laboratory Investigations at People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, will provide an overview of animal experimentation in the United States as the context in which this activism and political repression is emerging.
